Notice: NOTICE OF SALE UNDER POWER GEORGIA, ATHENS-CLARKE COUNTY. By virtue of power of sale contained in Real Estate Deed to Secure Debt from William A. Kelly to North Georgia Bank, dated December 4, 2001, recorded in Deed Book 2120, page 236, as assigned from the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation in its capacity as Receiver for North Georgia Bank to BankSouth pursuant to that certain Assignment of Security Instruments and other Loan Documents dated March 16, 2011, effective February 4, 2011, recorded at Deed Book 3815, page(s) 44, all in the Office of the Clerk of Superior Court of Athens-Clarke County, Georgia (hereinafter collectively referred to as the Security Deed) and pursuant to O.C.G.A. 11-9-604(a)(ii), there will be sold by the undersigned at public outcry to the highest bidder for cash before the Courthouse door in Athens-Clarke County Georgia, within the legal hours of sale on the first Tuesday in February, 2015, the following described property: All that lot or parcel of land, together with any improvements thereon, situate, lying and being on the southwesterly side of Hemlock Drive, in the 219th G.M.D., Athens-Clarke County, Georgia, being designated Lot 54, Block D, Section Eight, Willow Springs, according to a plat of said subdivision by Landmark Engineering Corporation, Surveyors, dated October 21, 1986, recorded in Plat Book 23, page 131, in the Office of Clerk of Superior Court of Athens-Clarke County, Georgia, which plat is hereby incorporated into this description by reference and made a part hereof; being more particularly described, according to said plat as follows: Beginning at an iron pin on the southwesterly side of Hemlock Drive 222.92 feet southeasterly of the intersection of Hemlock Way, as measured along the southwesterly side of Hemlock Drive; running thence along Hemlock Drive the following courses and distances: South 62 degrees 45 minutes 21 seconds east 32.29 feet to an iron pin, a chord measurement of South 52 degrees 25 minutes 41 seconds East 80.72 feet to an iron pin, South 42 degrees 01 minute 29 seconds East 37.80 feet to an iron pin, and South 55 degrees 04 minutes 22 seconds East 64.56 feet to an iron pin hereinafter called Iron Pin A; thence continuing South 55 degrees 04 minutes 22 seconds East 17 feet to a point in the center of a branch; running thence along the center of said branch, in a generally southwesterly direction, approximately 380 feet to an iron pin hereinafter called Iron Pin B, the chord measurements between Iron Pin A and Iron Pin B being: South 34 degrees 21 minutes 24 seconds West 50.20 feet to a point; South 66 degrees 19 minutes 30 seconds west 69.05 feet to a point, South 10 degrees 47 minutes 55 seconds East 55.00 feet to a point, South 61 degrees 12 minutes 15 seconds West 127.02 feet to a point and South 87 degrees 43 minutes 45 seconds West 80.00 feet; running thence from Iron Pin B along the boundary of Lot 52, Block D, North 11 degrees 24 minutes 47 seconds East 189.53 feet to an iron pin; running thence along the boundary of Lot 53; Block D, North 27 degrees 14 minutes 39 seconds east 140.00 feet to the beginning iron pin. Together with that certain 1997 Horton Manufactured Home, Horton ECH Model, having a V.I.N. of H82966GLR and Georgia Title No. 770145020442014 The residence situated upon the above described property is known and designated as 207 Hemlock Drive, Athens, Georgia 30601, according to the present system of numbering houses in Athens-Clarke County, Georgia. Together with all buildings, structures, and other improvements now or hereafter located on said property, or any part and parcel thereof. BankSouth, as successor in interest to North Georgia Bank, is the current holder and owner of the Security Deed and the promissory note secured thereby. The debt secured by the Security Deed has been and is hereby declared due because of, among other possible events of default, failure to pay amounts due under the promissory note secured by the Security Deed when due. Said default not being cured, and the debt remaining in default, the sale will be made for the purpose of paying the same and all expenses of the sale, including accrued attorneys fees. Said property will be sold by BankSouth, as successor in interest to North Georgia Bank, as attorney in fact for William A. Kelly, subject to any outstanding ad valorem taxes and/or assessments, and matters of record, if any, having priority over the Security Deed. To the best of the knowledge and belief of BankSouth, as successor in interest to North Georgia Bank, the person in possession of above described property is William A. Kelly or persons claiming under him. Said property will be sold and deed executed by the undersigned to the purchaser and the proceeds of sale applied by the undersigned, all as provided in said power of sale and the Security Deed containing said power. The following information is being provided in accordance with OCGA 44-14-162.2. BankSouth is the secured creditor under the Security Deed and loan being foreclosed. The following entity shall have full authority to negotiate, amend, and modify all terms of the above-described Security Deed and associated note on behalf of the secured creditor: BankSouth, P.O. Box 1499, Watkinsville, GA 30677; Telephone No.: (706) 769-8200, Attn: Foreclosures. OCGA 44-14-162.2 states in pertinent part that, nothing in this subsection shall be construed to require a secured creditor to negotiate, amend, or modify the terms of a mortgage instrument. BankSouth, as successor in interest to North Georgia Bank, as Attorney in Fact for William A. Kelly ALVIN L. BRIDGES III, ESQ. BLASINGAME, BURCH, GARRARD & ASHLEY, PC P.O. Box 832 Athens, Georgia 30603 Sale Date: February 3, 2015

The debt secured by said Security Deed has been and is hereby declared due because of, among other possible events of default, failure to pay the indebtedness as and when due and in the manner provided in the Note and Security Deed. (the Secured Creditor), by assignment, conveying the after described property to secure a Note of even date in the original principal amount of $177,625.00, with interest at the rate specified therein, there will be sold by the undersigned at public outcry to the highest bidder for cash at the ATHENS CLARKE County Courthouse within the legal hours of sale on the first Tuesday in March, 2015, the following described property: ALL THAT TRACT OR PARCEL OF LAND, TOGETHER WITH ALL IMPROVEMENTS THEREON, SITUATE, LYING AND BEING IN THE 241ST DISTRICT, G.M., ATHENS CLARKE COUNTY, GEORGIA, AND BEING KNOWN AND DESIGNATED AS LOT 9, BLOCK B, SECTION TWO, HUNTINGTON PARK SUBDIVISION, AND BEING MORE PARTICULARLY DESCRIBED ACCORDING TO A PLAT OF SURVEY BY BEN MCLEROY & ASSOCIATES, INC., BEN MCLEROY, RLS, DATED MAY 6, 1983, AND RECORDED IN PLAT BOOK 20, PAGE 90, IN THE OFFICE OF THE CLERK OF THE SUPERIOR COURT OF ATHENS CLARKE COUNTY, GEORGIA, REFERENCE TO WHICH IS HEREBY THE SAME PROPERTY CONVEYED BY DEED RECORDED IN DEED BOOK 448, PAGE 288, AFORESAID RECORDS. NOTICE OF SALE UNDER POWER GEORGIA, ATHENS-CLARKE COUNTY. By virtue of power of sale contained in Real Estate Deed to Secure Debt from William A. Kelly to North Georgia Bank, dated December 4, 2001, recorded in Deed Book 2120, page 236, as assigned from the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation in its capacity as Receiver for North Georgia Bank to BankSouth pursuant to that certain Assignment of Security Instruments and other Loan Documents dated March 16, 2011, effective February 4, 2011, recorded at Deed Book 3815, page(s) 44, all in the Office of the Clerk of Superior Court of Athens-Clarke County, Georgia (hereinafter collectively referred to as the Security Deed) and pursuant to O.C.G.A. 11-9-604(a)(ii), there will be sold by the undersigned at public outcry to the highest bidder for cash before the Courthouse door in Athens-Clarke County Georgia, within the legal hours of sale on the first Tuesday in February, 2015, the following described property: All that lot or parcel of land, together with any improvements thereon, situate, lying and being on the southwesterly side of Hemlock Drive, in the 219th G.M.D., Athens-Clarke County, Georgia, being designated Lot 54, Block D, Section Eight, Willow Springs, according to a plat of said subdivision by Landmark Engineering Corporation, Surveyors, dated October 21, 1986, recorded in Plat Book 23, page 131, in the Office of Clerk of Superior Court of Athens-Clarke County, Georgia, which plat is hereby incorporated into this description by reference and made a part hereof; being more particularly described, according to said plat as follows: Beginning at an iron pin on the southwesterly side of Hemlock Drive 222.92 feet southeasterly of the intersection of Hemlock Way, as measured along the southwesterly side of Hemlock Drive; running thence along Hemlock Drive the following courses and distances: South 62 degrees 45 minutes 21 seconds east 32.29 feet to an iron pin, a chord measurement of South 52 degrees 25 minutes 41 seconds East 80.72 feet to an iron pin, South 42 degrees 01 minute 29 seconds East 37.80 feet to an iron pin, and South 55 degrees 04 minutes 22 seconds East 64.56 feet to an iron pin hereinafter called Iron Pin A; thence continuing South 55 degrees 04 minutes 22 seconds East 17 feet to a point in the center of a branch; running thence along the center of said branch, in a generally southwesterly direction, approximately 380 feet to an iron pin hereinafter called Iron Pin B, the chord measurements between Iron Pin A and Iron Pin B being: South 34 degrees 21 minutes 24 seconds West 50.20 feet to a point; South 66 degrees 19 minutes 30 seconds west 69.05 feet to a point, South 10 degrees 47 minutes 55 seconds East 55.00 feet to a point, South 61 degrees 12 minutes 15 seconds West 127.02 feet to a point and South 87 degrees 43 minutes 45 seconds West 80.00 feet; running thence from Iron Pin B along the boundary of Lot 52, Block D, North 11 degrees 24 minutes 47 seconds East 189.53 feet to an iron pin; running thence along the boundary of Lot 53; Block D, North 27 degrees 14 minutes 39 seconds east 140.00 feet to the beginning iron pin. Together with that certain 1997 Horton Manufactured Home, Horton ECH Model, having a V.I.N. of H82966GLR and Georgia Title No. 770145020442014 The residence situated upon the above described property is known and designated as 207 Hemlock Drive, Athens, Georgia 30601, according to the present system of numbering houses in Athens-Clarke County, Georgia. Together with all buildings, structures, and other improvements now or hereafter located on said property, or any part and parcel thereof. BankSouth, as successor in interest to North Georgia Bank, is the current holder and owner of the Security Deed and the promissory note secured thereby. The debt secured by the Security Deed has been and is hereby declared due because of, among other possible events of default, failure to pay amounts due under the promissory note secured by the Security Deed when due. Said default not being cured, and the debt remaining in default, the sale will be made for the purpose of paying the same and all expenses of the sale, including accrued attorneys fees. Said property will be sold by BankSouth, as successor in interest to North Georgia Bank, as attorney in fact for William A. Kelly, subject to any outstanding ad valorem taxes and/or assessments, and matters of record, if any, having priority over the Security Deed. To the best of the knowledge and belief of BankSouth, as successor in interest to North Georgia Bank, the person in possession of above described property is William A. Kelly or persons claiming under him. Said property will be sold and deed executed by the undersigned to the purchaser and the proceeds of sale applied by the undersigned, all as provided in said power of sale and the Security Deed containing said power. The following information is being provided in accordance with OCGA 44-14-162.2. BankSouth is the secured creditor under the Security Deed and loan being foreclosed. The following entity shall have full authority to negotiate, amend, and modify all terms of the above-described Security Deed and associated note on behalf of the secured creditor: BankSouth, P.O. Box 1499, Watkinsville, GA 30677; Telephone No.: (706) 769-8200, Attn: Foreclosures. OCGA 44-14-162.2 states in pertinent part that, nothing in this subsection shall be construed to require a secured creditor to negotiate, amend, or modify the terms of a mortgage instrument. BankSouth, as successor in interest to North Georgia Bank, as Attorney in Fact for William A. Kelly ALVIN L. BRIDGES III, ESQ. BLASINGAME, BURCH, GARRARD & ASHLEY, PC P.O. Box 832 Athens, Georgia 30603 Sale Date: February 3, 2015

Rabon to Mortgage Electronic Registration Systems, Inc. as nominee for SunTrust Mortgage, Inc., dated January 15, 2008, and recorded in Deed Book 03447, Page 0320, Clarke County, Georgia Records, as last transferred to SunTrust Mortgage, Inc. by assignment recorded on November 10, 2014 in Book 4280 Page 244 in the Office of the Clerk of Superior Court of Clarke County, Georgia Records, conveying the after-described property to secure a Note in the original principal amount of One Hundred Twenty-One Thousand Two Hundred Forty-One and 0/100 dollars ($121,241.00), with interest thereon as set forth therein, there will be sold at public outcry to the highest bidder for cash before the courthouse door of Clarke County, Georgia, within the legal hours of sale on March 3, 2015, the following described property: All that tract or parcel of land, together with all improvements thereon, situate, lying and being in the 241st District, G.M., Athens-Clarke County, Georgia, and being more particularly known and designated as Lot 7 of E.B. Wood property, and being more particularly shown on a plat entitled Survey for Wanda Broaddrick Black, dated February 24, 1984 prepared by Landmark Engineering Corporation, certified by J.R. Holland, Georgia Registered Land Surveyor No. 1087, said plat being recorded in Plat Book 20, Page 235, in the Office of the Clerk of the Superior Court of Athens-Clarke County, Georgia. Reference is hereby made to the aforesaid plat and to the record thereof for all purposes of description and identification and for all other purposes allowed by law. The debt secured by said Security Deed has been and is hereby declared due because of, among other possible events of default, failure to pay the indebtedness as and when due and in the manner provided in the Note and Security Deed. The debt remaining in default, this sale will be made for the purpose of paying the same and all expenses of this sale, as provided in Security Deed and by law, including attorneys fees (notice of intent to collect attorneys fees having been given). Your mortgage servicer can be contacted at (800) 443-1032 - Loss Mitigation Dept, or by writing to PO Box 27767, Richmond, Virginia 23261, to discuss possible alternatives to avoid foreclosure. Said property will be sold subject to any outstanding ad valorem taxes (including taxes which are a lien, but not yet due and payable), any matters which might be disclosed by an accurate survey and inspection of the property, any assessments, liens, encumbrances, zoning ordinances, restrictions, covenants, and matters of record superior to the Security Deed first set out above. To the best knowledge and belief of the undersigned, the party in possession of the property is Robert D. Rabon or tenant(s); and said property is more commonly known as 210 Arrowhead Road, Bogart, GA 30622. The sale will be conducted subject to (1) confirmation that the sale is not prohibited under the U.S. Bankruptcy Code (2) final confirmation and audit of the status of the loan with the holder of the security deed and (3) any right of redemption or other lien not extinguished by foreclosure. SunTrust Mortgage, Inc. as Attorney in Fact for Robert D. Rabon. Brock & Scott, PLLC 4360 Chamblee Dunwoody Road Suite 310 Atlanta, GA 30341 404-789-2661 B&S file no.: 14-28380

Rabon to Mortgage Electronic Registration Systems, Inc. as nominee for SunTrust Mortgage, Inc., dated January 15, 2008, and recorded in Deed Book 03447, Page 0320, Clarke County, Georgia Records, as last transferred to SunTrust Mortgage, Inc. by assignment recorded on November 10, 2014 in Book 4280 Page 244 in the Office of the Clerk of Superior Court of Clarke County, Georgia Records, conveying the after-described property to secure a Note in the original principal amount of One Hundred Twenty-One Thousand Two Hundred Forty-One and 0/100 dollars ($121,241.00), with interest thereon as set forth therein, there will be sold at public outcry to the highest bidder for cash before the courthouse door of Clarke County, Georgia, within the legal hours of sale on March 3, 2015, the following described property: All that tract or parcel of land, together with all improvements thereon, situate, lying and being in the 241st District, G.M., Athens-Clarke County, Georgia, and being more particularly known and designated as Lot 7 of E.B. Wood property, and being more particularly shown on a plat entitled Survey for Wanda Broaddrick Black, dated February 24, 1984 prepared by Landmark Engineering Corporation, certified by J.R. Holland, Georgia Registered Land Surveyor No. 1087, said plat being recorded in Plat Book 20, Page 235, in the Office of the Clerk of the Superior Court of Athens-Clarke County, Georgia. Reference is hereby made to the aforesaid plat and to the record thereof for all purposes of description and identification and for all other purposes allowed by law. The debt secured by said Security Deed has been and is hereby declared due because of, among other possible events of default, failure to pay the indebtedness as and when due and in the manner provided in the Note and Security Deed. The debt remaining in default, this sale will be made for the purpose of paying the same and all expenses of this sale, as provided in Security Deed and by law, including attorneys fees (notice of intent to collect attorneys fees having been given). Your mortgage servicer can be contacted at (800) 443-1032 - Loss Mitigation Dept, or by writing to PO Box 27767, Richmond, Virginia 23261, to discuss possible alternatives to avoid foreclosure. Said property will be sold subject to any outstanding ad valorem taxes (including taxes which are a lien, but not yet due and payable), any matters which might be disclosed by an accurate survey and inspection of the property, any assessments, liens, encumbrances, zoning ordinances, restrictions, covenants, and matters of record superior to the Security Deed first set out above. To the best knowledge and belief of the undersigned, the party in possession of the property is Robert D. Rabon or tenant(s); and said property is more commonly known as 210 Arrowhead Road, Bogart, GA 30622. The sale will be conducted subject to (1) confirmation that the sale is not prohibited under the U.S. Bankruptcy Code (2) final confirmation and audit of the status of the loan with the holder of the security deed and (3) any right of redemption or other lien not extinguished by foreclosure. SunTrust Mortgage, Inc. as Attorney in Fact for Robert D. Rabon. Brock & Scott, PLLC 4360 Chamblee Dunwoody Road Suite 310 Atlanta, GA 30341 404-789-2661 B&S file no.: 14-28380

Rabon to Mortgage Electronic Registration Systems, Inc. as nominee for SunTrust Mortgage, Inc., dated January 15, 2008, and recorded in Deed Book 03447, Page 0320, Clarke County, Georgia Records, as last transferred to SunTrust Mortgage, Inc. by assignment recorded on November 10, 2014 in Book 4280 Page 244 in the Office of the Clerk of Superior Court of Clarke County, Georgia Records, conveying the after-described property to secure a Note in the original principal amount of One Hundred Twenty-One Thousand Two Hundred Forty-One and 0/100 dollars ($121,241.00), with interest thereon as set forth therein, there will be sold at public outcry to the highest bidder for cash before the courthouse door of Clarke County, Georgia, within the legal hours of sale on March 3, 2015, the following described property: All that tract or parcel of land, together with all improvements thereon, situate, lying and being in the 241st District, G.M., Athens-Clarke County, Georgia, and being more particularly known and designated as Lot 7 of E.B. Wood property, and being more particularly shown on a plat entitled Survey for Wanda Broaddrick Black, dated February 24, 1984 prepared by Landmark Engineering Corporation, certified by J.R. Holland, Georgia Registered Land Surveyor No. 1087, said plat being recorded in Plat Book 20, Page 235, in the Office of the Clerk of the Superior Court of Athens-Clarke County, Georgia. Reference is hereby made to the aforesaid plat and to the record thereof for all purposes of description and identification and for all other purposes allowed by law. The debt secured by said Security Deed has been and is hereby declared due because of, among other possible events of default, failure to pay the indebtedness as and when due and in the manner provided in the Note and Security Deed. The debt remaining in default, this sale will be made for the purpose of paying the same and all expenses of this sale, as provided in Security Deed and by law, including attorneys fees (notice of intent to collect attorneys fees having been given). Your mortgage servicer can be contacted at (800) 443-1032 - Loss Mitigation Dept, or by writing to PO Box 27767, Richmond, Virginia 23261, to discuss possible alternatives to avoid foreclosure. Said property will be sold subject to any outstanding ad valorem taxes (including taxes which are a lien, but not yet due and payable), any matters which might be disclosed by an accurate survey and inspection of the property, any assessments, liens, encumbrances, zoning ordinances, restrictions, covenants, and matters of record superior to the Security Deed first set out above. To the best knowledge and belief of the undersigned, the party in possession of the property is Robert D. Rabon or tenant(s); and said property is more commonly known as 210 Arrowhead Road, Bogart, GA 30622. The sale will be conducted subject to (1) confirmation that the sale is not prohibited under the U.S. Bankruptcy Code (2) final confirmation and audit of the status of the loan with the holder of the security deed and (3) any right of redemption or other lien not extinguished by foreclosure. SunTrust Mortgage, Inc. as Attorney in Fact for Robert D. Rabon. Brock & Scott, PLLC 4360 Chamblee Dunwoody Road Suite 310 Atlanta, GA 30341 404-789-2661 B&S file no.: 14-28380

Rabon to Mortgage Electronic Registration Systems, Inc. as nominee for SunTrust Mortgage, Inc., dated January 15, 2008, and recorded in Deed Book 03447, Page 0320, Clarke County, Georgia Records, as last transferred to SunTrust Mortgage, Inc. by assignment recorded on November 10, 2014 in Book 4280 Page 244 in the Office of the Clerk of Superior Court of Clarke County, Georgia Records, conveying the after-described property to secure a Note in the original principal amount of One Hundred Twenty-One Thousand Two Hundred Forty-One and 0/100 dollars ($121,241.00), with interest thereon as set forth therein, there will be sold at public outcry to the highest bidder for cash before the courthouse door of Clarke County, Georgia, within the legal hours of sale on March 3, 2015, the following described property: All that tract or parcel of land, together with all improvements thereon, situate, lying and being in the 241st District, G.M., Athens-Clarke County, Georgia, and being more particularly known and designated as Lot 7 of E.B. Wood property, and being more particularly shown on a plat entitled Survey for Wanda Broaddrick Black, dated February 24, 1984 prepared by Landmark Engineering Corporation, certified by J.R. Holland, Georgia Registered Land Surveyor No. 1087, said plat being recorded in Plat Book 20, Page 235, in the Office of the Clerk of the Superior Court of Athens-Clarke County, Georgia. Reference is hereby made to the aforesaid plat and to the record thereof for all purposes of description and identification and for all other purposes allowed by law. The debt secured by said Security Deed has been and is hereby declared due because of, among other possible events of default, failure to pay the indebtedness as and when due and in the manner provided in the Note and Security Deed. The debt remaining in default, this sale will be made for the purpose of paying the same and all expenses of this sale, as provided in Security Deed and by law, including attorneys fees (notice of intent to collect attorneys fees having been given). Your mortgage servicer can be contacted at (800) 443-1032 - Loss Mitigation Dept, or by writing to PO Box 27767, Richmond, Virginia 23261, to discuss possible alternatives to avoid foreclosure. Said property will be sold subject to any outstanding ad valorem taxes (including taxes which are a lien, but not yet due and payable), any matters which might be disclosed by an accurate survey and inspection of the property, any assessments, liens, encumbrances, zoning ordinances, restrictions, covenants, and matters of record superior to the Security Deed first set out above. To the best knowledge and belief of the undersigned, the party in possession of the property is Robert D. Rabon or tenant(s); and said property is more commonly known as 210 Arrowhead Road, Bogart, GA 30622. The sale will be conducted subject to (1) confirmation that the sale is not prohibited under the U.S. Bankruptcy Code (2) final confirmation and audit of the status of the loan with the holder of the security deed and (3) any right of redemption or other lien not extinguished by foreclosure. SunTrust Mortgage, Inc. as Attorney in Fact for Robert D. Rabon. Brock & Scott, PLLC 4360 Chamblee Dunwoody Road Suite 310 Atlanta, GA 30341 404-789-2661 B&S file no.: 14-28380

Rabon to Mortgage Electronic Registration Systems, Inc. as nominee for SunTrust Mortgage, Inc., dated January 15, 2008, and recorded in Deed Book 03447, Page 0320, Clarke County, Georgia Records, as last transferred to SunTrust Mortgage, Inc. by assignment recorded on November 10, 2014 in Book 4280 Page 244 in the Office of the Clerk of Superior Court of Clarke County, Georgia Records, conveying the after-described property to secure a Note in the original principal amount of One Hundred Twenty-One Thousand Two Hundred Forty-One and 0/100 dollars ($121,241.00), with interest thereon as set forth therein, there will be sold at public outcry to the highest bidder for cash before the courthouse door of Clarke County, Georgia, within the legal hours of sale on March 3, 2015, the following described property: All that tract or parcel of land, together with all improvements thereon, situate, lying and being in the 241st District, G.M., Athens-Clarke County, Georgia, and being more particularly known and designated as Lot 7 of E.B. Wood property, and being more particularly shown on a plat entitled Survey for Wanda Broaddrick Black, dated February 24, 1984 prepared by Landmark Engineering Corporation, certified by J.R. Holland, Georgia Registered Land Surveyor No. 1087, said plat being recorded in Plat Book 20, Page 235, in the Office of the Clerk of the Superior Court of Athens-Clarke County, Georgia. Reference is hereby made to the aforesaid plat and to the record thereof for all purposes of description and identification and for all other purposes allowed by law. The debt secured by said Security Deed has been and is hereby declared due because of, among other possible events of default, failure to pay the indebtedness as and when due and in the manner provided in the Note and Security Deed. The debt remaining in default, this sale will be made for the purpose of paying the same and all expenses of this sale, as provided in Security Deed and by law, including attorneys fees (notice of intent to collect attorneys fees having been given). Your mortgage servicer can be contacted at (800) 443-1032 - Loss Mitigation Dept, or by writing to PO Box 27767, Richmond, Virginia 23261, to discuss possible alternatives to avoid foreclosure. Said property will be sold subject to any outstanding ad valorem taxes (including taxes which are a lien, but not yet due and payable), any matters which might be disclosed by an accurate survey and inspection of the property, any assessments, liens, encumbrances, zoning ordinances, restrictions, covenants, and matters of record superior to the Security Deed first set out above. To the best knowledge and belief of the undersigned, the party in possession of the property is Robert D. Rabon or tenant(s); and said property is more commonly known as 210 Arrowhead Road, Bogart, GA 30622. The sale will be conducted subject to (1) confirmation that the sale is not prohibited under the U.S. Bankruptcy Code (2) final confirmation and audit of the status of the loan with the holder of the security deed and (3) any right of redemption or other lien not extinguished by foreclosure. SunTrust Mortgage, Inc. as Attorney in Fact for Robert D. Rabon. Brock & Scott, PLLC 4360 Chamblee Dunwoody Road Suite 310 Atlanta, GA 30341 404-789-2661 B&S file no.: 14-28380

Rabon to Mortgage Electronic Registration Systems, Inc. as nominee for SunTrust Mortgage, Inc., dated January 15, 2008, and recorded in Deed Book 03447, Page 0320, Clarke County, Georgia Records, as last transferred to SunTrust Mortgage, Inc. by assignment recorded on November 10, 2014 in Book 4280 Page 244 in the Office of the Clerk of Superior Court of Clarke County, Georgia Records, conveying the after-described property to secure a Note in the original principal amount of One Hundred Twenty-One Thousand Two Hundred Forty-One and 0/100 dollars ($121,241.00), with interest thereon as set forth therein, there will be sold at public outcry to the highest bidder for cash before the courthouse door of Clarke County, Georgia, within the legal hours of sale on March 3, 2015, the following described property: All that tract or parcel of land, together with all improvements thereon, situate, lying and being in the 241st District, G.M., Athens-Clarke County, Georgia, and being more particularly known and designated as Lot 7 of E.B. Wood property, and being more particularly shown on a plat entitled Survey for Wanda Broaddrick Black, dated February 24, 1984 prepared by Landmark Engineering Corporation, certified by J.R. Holland, Georgia Registered Land Surveyor No. 1087, said plat being recorded in Plat Book 20, Page 235, in the Office of the Clerk of the Superior Court of Athens-Clarke County, Georgia. Reference is hereby made to the aforesaid plat and to the record thereof for all purposes of description and identification and for all other purposes allowed by law. The debt secured by said Security Deed has been and is hereby declared due because of, among other possible events of default, failure to pay the indebtedness as and when due and in the manner provided in the Note and Security Deed. The debt remaining in default, this sale will be made for the purpose of paying the same and all expenses of this sale, as provided in Security Deed and by law, including attorneys fees (notice of intent to collect attorneys fees having been given). Your mortgage servicer can be contacted at (800) 443-1032 - Loss Mitigation Dept, or by writing to PO Box 27767, Richmond, Virginia 23261, to discuss possible alternatives to avoid foreclosure. Said property will be sold subject to any outstanding ad valorem taxes (including taxes which are a lien, but not yet due and payable), any matters which might be disclosed by an accurate survey and inspection of the property, any assessments, liens, encumbrances, zoning ordinances, restrictions, covenants, and matters of record superior to the Security Deed first set out above. To the best knowledge and belief of the undersigned, the party in possession of the property is Robert D. Rabon or tenant(s); and said property is more commonly known as 210 Arrowhead Road, Bogart, GA 30622. The sale will be conducted subject to (1) confirmation that the sale is not prohibited under the U.S. Bankruptcy Code (2) final confirmation and audit of the status of the loan with the holder of the security deed and (3) any right of redemption or other lien not extinguished by foreclosure. SunTrust Mortgage, Inc. as Attorney in Fact for Robert D. Rabon. Brock & Scott, PLLC 4360 Chamblee Dunwoody Road Suite 310 Atlanta, GA 30341 404-789-2661 B&S file no.: 14-28380

(the Secured Creditor), by assignment, conveying the afterdescribed property to secure a Note of even date in the original principal amount of $187,475.00, with interest at the rate specified therein, there will be sold by the undersigned at public outcry to the highest bidder for cash at the CLAYTON County Courthouse within the legal hours of sale on the first Tuesday in March, 2015, the following described property: ALL THAT TRACT OR PARCEL OF LAND LYING AND BEING IN LAND LOT 215 AND 234 OF THE 5TH DISTRICT, CLAYTON COUNTY, GEORGIA, BEING LOT 29, OF OVERLOOK AT CAMP CREEK SUBDIVISION, AS PER PLAT THEREOF RECORDED IN PLAT BOOK 38, PAGE 8084, CLAYTON COUNTY, GEORGIA RECORDS, WHICH RECORDED PLAT IS INCORPORATED HEREIN BY REFERENCE AND MADE A PART OF THIS DESCRIPTION. The debt secured by said Deed to Secure Debt has been and is hereby declared due because of, among other possible events of default, failure to pay the indebtedness as and when due and in the manner provided in the Note and Deed to Secure Debt.  Because the debt remains in default, this sale will be made for the purpose of paying the same and all expenses of this sale, as provided in the Deed to Secure Debt and by law, including attorneys fees (notice of intent to collect attorneys fees having been given). (the Secured Creditor), by assignment, conveying the afterdescribed property to secure a Note of even date in the original principal amount of $187,475.00, with interest at the rate specified therein, there will be sold by the undersigned at public outcry to the highest bidder for cash at the CLAYTON County Courthouse within the legal hours of sale on the first Tuesday in March, 2015, the following described property: ALL THAT TRACT OR PARCEL OF LAND LYING AND BEING IN LAND LOT 215 AND 234 OF THE 5TH DISTRICT, CLAYTON COUNTY, GEORGIA, BEING LOT 29, OF OVERLOOK AT CAMP CREEK SUBDIVISION, AS PER PLAT THEREOF RECORDED IN PLAT BOOK 38, PAGE 8084, CLAYTON COUNTY, GEORGIA RECORDS, WHICH RECORDED PLAT IS INCORPORATED HEREIN BY REFERENCE AND MADE A PART OF THIS DESCRIPTION. The debt secured by said Deed to Secure Debt has been and is hereby declared due because of, among other possible events of default, failure to pay the indebtedness as and when due and in the manner provided in the Note and Deed to Secure Debt.  Because the debt remains in default, this sale will be made for the purpose of paying the same and all expenses of this sale, as provided in the Deed to Secure Debt and by law, including attorneys fees (notice of intent to collect attorneys fees having been given). (the Secured Creditor), by assignment, conveying the afterdescribed property to secure a Note of even date in the original principal amount of $187,475.00, with interest at the rate specified therein, there will be sold by the undersigned at public outcry to the highest bidder for cash at the CLAYTON County Courthouse within the legal hours of sale on the first Tuesday in March, 2015, the following described property: ALL THAT TRACT OR PARCEL OF LAND LYING AND BEING IN LAND LOT 215 AND 234 OF THE 5TH DISTRICT, CLAYTON COUNTY, GEORGIA, BEING LOT 29, OF OVERLOOK AT CAMP CREEK SUBDIVISION, AS PER PLAT THEREOF RECORDED IN PLAT BOOK 38, PAGE 8084, CLAYTON COUNTY, GEORGIA RECORDS, WHICH RECORDED PLAT IS INCORPORATED HEREIN BY REFERENCE AND MADE A PART OF THIS DESCRIPTION. The debt secured by said Deed to Secure Debt has been and is hereby declared due because of, among other possible events of default, failure to pay the indebtedness as and when due and in the manner provided in the Note and Deed to Secure Debt.  Because the debt remains in default, this sale will be made for the purpose of paying the same and all expenses of this sale, as provided in the Deed to Secure Debt and by law, including attorneys fees (notice of intent to collect attorneys fees having been given). (the Secured Creditor), by assignment, conveying the afterdescribed property to secure a Note of even date in the original principal amount of $187,475.00, with interest at the rate specified therein, there will be sold by the undersigned at public outcry to the highest bidder for cash at the CLAYTON County Courthouse within the legal hours of sale on the first Tuesday in March, 2015, the following described property: ALL THAT TRACT OR PARCEL OF LAND LYING AND BEING IN LAND LOT 215 AND 234 OF THE 5TH DISTRICT, CLAYTON COUNTY, GEORGIA, BEING LOT 29, OF OVERLOOK AT CAMP CREEK SUBDIVISION, AS PER PLAT THEREOF RECORDED IN PLAT BOOK 38, PAGE 8084, CLAYTON COUNTY, GEORGIA RECORDS, WHICH RECORDED PLAT IS INCORPORATED HEREIN BY REFERENCE AND MADE A PART OF THIS DESCRIPTION. The debt secured by said Deed to Secure Debt has been and is hereby declared due because of, among other possible events of default, failure to pay the indebtedness as and when due and in the manner provided in the Note and Deed to Secure Debt.  Because the debt remains in default, this sale will be made for the purpose of paying the same and all expenses of this sale, as provided in the Deed to Secure Debt and by law, including attorneys fees (notice of intent to collect attorneys fees having been given). (the Secured Creditor), by assignment, conveying the afterdescribed property to secure a Note of even date in the original principal amount of $187,475.00, with interest at the rate specified therein, there will be sold by the undersigned at public outcry to the highest bidder for cash at the CLAYTON County Courthouse within the legal hours of sale on the first Tuesday in March, 2015, the following described property: ALL THAT TRACT OR PARCEL OF LAND LYING AND BEING IN LAND LOT 215 AND 234 OF THE 5TH DISTRICT, CLAYTON COUNTY, GEORGIA, BEING LOT 29, OF OVERLOOK AT CAMP CREEK SUBDIVISION, AS PER PLAT THEREOF RECORDED IN PLAT BOOK 38, PAGE 8084, CLAYTON COUNTY, GEORGIA RECORDS, WHICH RECORDED PLAT IS INCORPORATED HEREIN BY REFERENCE AND MADE A PART OF THIS DESCRIPTION. The debt secured by said Deed to Secure Debt has been and is hereby declared due because of, among other possible events of default, failure to pay the indebtedness as and when due and in the manner provided in the Note and Deed to Secure Debt.  Because the debt remains in default, this sale will be made for the purpose of paying the same and all expenses of this sale, as provided in the Deed to Secure Debt and by law, including attorneys fees (notice of intent to collect attorneys fees having been given). (the Secured Creditor), by assignment, conveying the afterdescribed property to secure a Note of even date in the original principal amount of $187,475.00, with interest at the rate specified therein, there will be sold by the undersigned at public outcry to the highest bidder for cash at the CLAYTON County Courthouse within the legal hours of sale on the first Tuesday in March, 2015, the following described property: ALL THAT TRACT OR PARCEL OF LAND LYING AND BEING IN LAND LOT 215 AND 234 OF THE 5TH DISTRICT, CLAYTON COUNTY, GEORGIA, BEING LOT 29, OF OVERLOOK AT CAMP CREEK SUBDIVISION, AS PER PLAT THEREOF RECORDED IN PLAT BOOK 38, PAGE 8084, CLAYTON COUNTY, GEORGIA RECORDS, WHICH RECORDED PLAT IS INCORPORATED HEREIN BY REFERENCE AND MADE A PART OF THIS DESCRIPTION. The debt secured by said Deed to Secure Debt has been and is hereby declared due because of, among other possible events of default, failure to pay the indebtedness as and when due and in the manner provided in the Note and Deed to Secure Debt.  Because the debt remains in default, this sale will be made for the purpose of paying the same and all expenses of this sale, as provided in the Deed to Secure Debt and by law, including attorneys fees (notice of intent to collect attorneys fees having been given). (the Secured Creditor), by assignment, conveying the afterdescribed property to secure a Note of even date in the original principal amount of $187,475.00, with interest at the rate specified therein, there will be sold by the undersigned at public outcry to the highest bidder for cash at the CLAYTON County Courthouse within the legal hours of sale on the first Tuesday in March, 2015, the following described property: ALL THAT TRACT OR PARCEL OF LAND LYING AND BEING IN LAND LOT 215 AND 234 OF THE 5TH DISTRICT, CLAYTON COUNTY, GEORGIA, BEING LOT 29, OF OVERLOOK AT CAMP CREEK SUBDIVISION, AS PER PLAT THEREOF RECORDED IN PLAT BOOK 38, PAGE 8084, CLAYTON COUNTY, GEORGIA RECORDS, WHICH RECORDED PLAT IS INCORPORATED HEREIN BY REFERENCE AND MADE A PART OF THIS DESCRIPTION. The debt secured by said Deed to Secure Debt has been and is hereby declared due because of, among other possible events of default, failure to pay the indebtedness as and when due and in the manner provided in the Note and Deed to Secure Debt.  Because the debt remains in default, this sale will be made for the purpose of paying the same and all expenses of this sale, as provided in the Deed to Secure Debt and by law, including attorneys fees (notice of intent to collect attorneys fees having been given). (the Secured Creditor), by assignment, conveying the afterdescribed property to secure a Note of even date in the original principal amount of $187,475.00, with interest at the rate specified therein, there will be sold by the undersigned at public outcry to the highest bidder for cash at the CLAYTON County Courthouse within the legal hours of sale on the first Tuesday in March, 2015, the following described property: ALL THAT TRACT OR PARCEL OF LAND LYING AND BEING IN LAND LOT 215 AND 234 OF THE 5TH DISTRICT, CLAYTON COUNTY, GEORGIA, BEING LOT 29, OF OVERLOOK AT CAMP CREEK SUBDIVISION, AS PER PLAT THEREOF RECORDED IN PLAT BOOK 38, PAGE 8084, CLAYTON COUNTY, GEORGIA RECORDS, WHICH RECORDED PLAT IS INCORPORATED HEREIN BY REFERENCE AND MADE A PART OF THIS DESCRIPTION. The debt secured by said Deed to Secure Debt has been and is hereby declared due because of, among other possible events of default, failure to pay the indebtedness as and when due and in the manner provided in the Note and Deed to Secure Debt.  Because the debt remains in default, this sale will be made for the purpose of paying the same and all expenses of this sale, as provided in the Deed to Secure Debt and by law, including attorneys fees (notice of intent to collect attorneys fees having been given). SAID UNIT IS SUBJECT TO THE DECLARATION OF CONDOMINIUM FOR POWERS FERRY GREEN, A CONDOMINIUM, RECORDED IN DEED BOOK 3564, PAGE 1, COBB COUNTY, GEORGIA RECORDS, AS AMENDED, SAID DECLARATION BEING INCORPORATED HEREIN BY REFERENCE THERETO. The debt remaining in default, this sale will be made for the purpose of paying same and all expenses of the sale, as provided in the Georgia Condominium Act, O.C.G.A.  44-3-70, et seq., and the Declaration (notice of attempt to collect attorney's fees having been given). The excess, if any, will be distributed to the person or persons legally entitled thereto. Said property will be sold subject to (a) any outstanding ad valorem taxes (including taxes which are a lien but not yet due and payable), (b) any matters which might be disclosed by an accurate survey and inspection of the property, (c) the Declaration, as amended, and (d) all matters of record superior to the condominium lien first set out above, including but not limited to the Security Deed from Kathy A. Duby to HomeBanc Mortgage Corporation, recorded at Deed Book 13991, Page 4041 of the aforesaid records, and any encumbrances, zoning ordinances, restrictions, covenants and matters of record superior to the condominium lien first set out above. The sale will be conducted subject to (1) confirmation that the sale is not prohibited under the United States Bankruptcy Code, and (2) final confirmation and audit of the status of the lien with the holder of the Order to foreclose. The Cobb County Sheriff makes no warranties whatsoever as to the above-described property. The Sheriff specifically makes no warranty of title as to defects of title or survey or liens and encumbrances or other title defects in conjunction with the sale. The Sheriff reserves the right to reject any and all bids made, regardless of the amount, for the purchase of the above-described property. Purchaser shall pay all costs in connection with the sale. Govern yourself accordingly. This the 19th  day of December, 2014. NEIL WARREN Sheriff of Cobb County, Georgia Powers Ferry Green Condominium Association, Inc. c/o Laura D. WHEREAS, the Security Instrument secures, in part, a loan (the "Loan") as evidenced by that certain Promissory Note (the "Note"), dated December 13, 2004, executed by Borrower and payable to the order of Original Lender, in the original principal amount of Two Million One Hundred Thousand and 00/100 Dollars ($2,100,000.00), as such Note was subsequently endorsed and assigned to Holder; and WHEREAS, defaults and Events of Default have occurred and are continuing under the Note and the Security Instrument, specifically including, without limitation, the failure of Borrower to make the regular monthly payments of principal and interest on the dates on which such payments were due under the Note; and WHEREAS, by reason of such defaults and Events of Default, the Indebtedness has been, and is hereby confirmed, accelerated and declared immediately due and payable, and the Security Instrument has become, is, and is hereby subject to foreclosure as provided by law, the Note and the Security Instrument; and WHEREAS, prior to the consummation of the exercise of the power of sale contained in the Security Instrument and the consummation of the foreclosure sale of the Property, the Replacement Reserves, the TI and Leasing Reserves, if any, and any and all other funds, cash, letters of credit and other sums, if any, held by Holder for or on behalf of Borrower, in escrow, in reserve or in other accounts established under the Note, the Security Instrument and/or any other Loan Document, for payment of taxes, assessments and other similar charges levied against the Property, insurance, capital improvements, replacements, tenant improvements, leasing commissions or otherwise (collectively, the "Funds") have been or shall be applied by Holder toward payment of the Indebtedness and any other amounts due under the Note, the Security Instrument and any other Loan Document, to the extent provided in such documents. NOW, THEREFORE, under and pursuant to the power of sale contained in the Security Instrument and according to the terms of the Security Instrument and the laws in such cases made and provided, Holder will expose the Property (less and except the Funds) for sale, at public sale to the highest bidder, for cash on that certain first Tuesday in March, 2015, being March 3, 2015, during the legal hours for sale, before the courthouse door in Cobb County, Georgia. The Indebtedness remaining in default and the aforesaid defaults and Events of Default continuing, the sale of the Property (less and except the Funds) under and pursuant to the power of sale contained in the Security Instrument will be made for the purpose of applying the proceeds thereof, as provided for in the Security Instrument and pursuant to applicable law. Pursuant to the Power of Sale contained in a Security Deed given by William B Spivey to Mortgage Electronic Registration Systems, Inc. as nominee for Citizens Security Bank dated 11/26/2003 and recorded in Deed Book 1056 Page 67, Coffee County, Georgia records; as last transferred to or acquired by JPMorgan Chase Bank, National Association, conveying the after-described property to secure a Note in the original principal amount of $ 41,300.00, with interest at the rate specified therein, there will be sold by the undersigned at public outcry to the highest bidder for cash before the Courthouse door of  Coffee County, Georgia, within the legal hours of sale on March 03, 2015 (being the first Tuesday of said month unless said date falls on a Federal Holiday), the following described property:
All that certain tract or parcel of land lying and being situate in the City of Douglas, Georgia and being more particularly described as follows: Being all that tract of land consisting of 0.24 acres, as shown and depicted on a certain Plat prepared by Statewide Surveying Company, dated September 27, 1993 and recorded in Plat Book 69, Page 39, in the Public Records of Coffee County, Georgia, which plat is incorporated herein by reference as a part of this description.
The debt secured by said Security Deed has been and is hereby declared due because of, among other possible events of default, failure to pay the indebtedness as and when due and in the manner provided in the Note and Security Deed. The debt remaining in default, this sale will be made for the purpose of paying the same and all expenses of this sale, as provided in the Security Deed and by law, including attorneys fees (notice of intent to collect attorneys fees having been given).
Said property is commonly known as 1303 North Pearl Avenue, Douglas, GA 31533 together with all fixtures and personal property attached to and constituting a part of said property, if any. To the best knowledge and belief of the undersigned, the party (or parties) in possession of the subject property is (are): William Benji Spivey or tenant or tenants.
JPMorgan Chase Bank, NA is the entity or individual designated who shall have full authority to negotiate, amend and modify all terms of the mortgage.
JPMorgan Chase Bank, NA
Homeowner's Assistance Department
3415 Vision Drive
Columbus, Ohio 43219
1-866-550-5705
Note, however, that such entity or individual is not required by law to negotiate, amend or modify the terms of the loan.
Said property will be sold subject to: (a) any outstanding ad valorem taxes (including taxes which are a lien, but not yet due and payable), (b) unpaid water or sewage bills that constitute a lien against the property whether due and payable or not yet due and payable and which may not be of record, (c) the right of redemption of any taxing authority, (d) any matters which might be disclosed by an accurate survey and inspection of the property, and (e) any assessments, liens, encumbrances, zoning ordinances, restrictions, covenants, and matters of record superior to the Security Deed first set out above.
The sale will be conducted subject to (1) confirmation that the sale is not prohibited under the U.S. Bankruptcy Code; and (2) final confirmation and audit of the status of the loan with the holder of the Security Deed. Pursuant to O.C.G.A. Section 9-13-172.1, which allows for certain procedures regarding the rescission of judicial and non-judicial sales in the State of Georgia, the Deed Under Power and other foreclosure documents may not be provided until final confirmation and audit of the status of the loan as provided immediately above.
JPMorgan Chase Bank, National Association as agent and Attorney in Fact for William B Spivey

SAID UNIT IS SUBJECT TO THE DECLARATION OF CONDOMINIUM FOR POWERS FERRY GREEN, A CONDOMINIUM, RECORDED IN DEED BOOK 3564, PAGE 1, COBB COUNTY, GEORGIA RECORDS, AS AMENDED, SAID DECLARATION BEING INCORPORATED HEREIN BY REFERENCE THERETO. The debt secured by the Association's lien, which totals $14,421.23 as of November 5, 2014, has been and is hereby declared due because of failure to pay the indebtedness as and when due and in the manner provided for in the Declaration. The debt remaining in default, this sale will be made for the purpose of paying same and all expenses of the sale, as provided in the Georgia Condominium Act, O.C.G.A.  44-3-70, et seq., and the Declaration (notice of attempt to collect attorney's fees having been given). The excess, if any, will be distributed to the person or persons legally entitled thereto. To the best knowledge and belief of the undersigned, the party(ies) in possession of the Subject Property known as 502 Ivy Green Lane, Marietta GA 30067 is Kathy A. Duby. Said property will be sold subject to (a) any outstanding ad valorem taxes (including taxes which are a lien but not yet due and payable), (b) any matters which might be disclosed by an accurate survey and inspection of the property, (c) the Declaration, as amended, and (d) all matters of record superior to the condominium lien first set out above, including but not limited to the Security Deed from Kathy A. Duby to HomeBanc Mortgage Corporation, recorded at Deed Book 13991, Page 4041 of the aforesaid records, and any encumbrances, zoning ordinances, restrictions, covenants and matters of record superior to the condominium lien first set out above. M. Brunier & Associates, Inc., recorded in Floor Plan Condominium Book 102, Page 35 (The "Floor Plans"), and in the Declaration of Condominium for Parkview Commons Condominiums, dated July 2, 2002, and recorded in Deed Book 13556, Page 4909, (The "Declaration"), said Plat, Floor Plans and Declaration all being recorded in the Real Estate Records of Cobb County, Georgia, together with said Condominium Units appurtenant percentage of undivided interest in the common elements of Parkview Commons Condominiums, as provided in said Declaration, which Declaration, Plat and Floor Plans, including and all amendments or supplements thereto, are incorporated herein by reference as a. part of this description. The aforedescribed real property is also known as 6971 Gallant Circle SE, #8, Mableton, GA 30126, according to the present system of numbering houses in Cobb County, Georgia. This sale will be conducted subject (1) to confirmation that the sale is not prohibited under the U.S. Bankruptcy Code and (2) to final confirmation and audit as to the amount and status of the loan with the holder of the Security Deed, including but not limited to, a determination that the borrower has not reinstated the loan prior to the foreclosure sale. The name, address and telephone number of the individual or entity with full authority to negotiate, amend and modify all terms of the Note and Security Deed is Space Coast Credit Union, Attn: Foreclosure Department, 3700 Lakeside Drive, Miramar, FL 33027. The telephone number is 1-800-447-7228.  The fax number is (321) 752-3095. Said real property will be sold subject to any outstanding ad valorem taxes (including taxes which are a lien, but not yet due and payable), the right of redemption of any taxing authority, any matters which might be disclosed by an accurate survey and inspection of the real property, any assessments, liens, encumbrances, zoning ordinances, restrictions, covenants, and matters of record superior to the Security Deed first set out above. To the extent that said real property is comprised of more than one parcel, said real property will be sold in one or more parcels and in such order as the holder of the Security Deed may determine.
